title: Is it okay to judge people for being deceived? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends upon your religion or your moral code It is a naive judgement to make because everyone is capable of being deceived An example would be Isaac Newton, who was one of the smartest people in recorded history and yet was deceived by the unthinking natural Universe itself, perhaps with help from the surrounding culture, into believing many processes were the result of a god If a physical process is capable of deceiving the smartest human, then how much more susceptible to deception are we by thinking entities who are actively trying to deceive?

Discerning that a person may have been deceived is a spiritual skill akin to Wisdom. It is never ok to apply condemnation to (judge) anyone for any reason (from an inferior mental attitude with a superiority complex).
